result.execSummary:
The defendant Sara Jo Carmichael was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

3:09 p.m.
Clerk Micki 

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Greg Venturini;

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
COUNT 1: Criminal Damage to Property, Domestic Abuse >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to:
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse >> GUILTY. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: $25.00 fine; DV surcharge; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC. 

Adj: 3:17 p.m.
Plea hearing on October 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Greg Venturini.

Date and time set for JPTC. VRCW.

Atty Venturini makes statement regarding resolution to this case. Request defendant be excused from PTC.
DDA Lawrence does not object.
COURT grants defendant be excused from PTC.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): W.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (WSPD).    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Nikki. 
Case Called: 2:51pm.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
VCRW.
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction.
Court questions defendant re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY by COURT.

$500.00 signature, $350 prior post to be converted and returned.

CONDITIONS:
-No contact with victim(s): W.B.
-Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (WSPD).
-No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents.
-Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.
-Prints and photograph.
